data.title: The son almost rises: Cambodia's Hun Sen the power behind throne - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet kept a low profile at the ASEAN summit in Vientiane.

data.title: Revived Cambodian Nationalism Threatens to Undermine ‘Special’ Relationship With Vietnam - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Anti-Vietnamese resentment has spelled an end to a cross-border cooperation agreement with Vietnam and Laos.

data.title: Real-life ‘Temple Run’ trend a tourism boost for Cambodia’s historic sites - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A unique blend of ancient culture and modern technology has captured the imagination of tourists visiting Cambodia.

data.description: As Southeast Asian countries band together to silence critics, advocates call for an urgent reassessment of human rights policies.

data.title: Supercars line up at Cambodia's Angkor Wat temples - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The centuries-old temples of Cambodia’s famed Angkor Wat played host to a parade of Rolls-Royces, Ferraris and Lamborghinis Tuesday, although drivers were banned from revving their supercharged engines. The event was intended to promote the environmentally sensitive UNESCO-listed World Heritage site, where the ruins of the Khmer empire’s greatest monuments are surrounded by lush forests […]

data.title: Japan’s sensitive approach to cooperation with Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Japanese academic Shin Kawashima notes that Japan-Cambodia relations have grown in the past few decades, but there is still a way to go before Japan can match the US and China in contributing resources and assistance to Cambodia in areas such as security and economy.

data.title: Community forest or corporate fortune? How public land became a mine in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Mongabay features writer Gerry Flynn joins Mongabay’s podcast to discuss a new investigation he published with freelance journalist Nehru Pry looking at how mining company Lin Vatey acquired thousands of hectares of a public forest.

data.title: Near-extinct crocodiles make comeback in Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia has welcomed 60 baby Siamese crocodiles - a hatching record for the endangered species in this century, conservationists say.

data.title: Reporter who revealed deforestation in Cambodia now charged with deforestation - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Ouk Mao was instrumental in bringing to light the takeover of the Phnom Chum Rok Sat community forest in Stung Treng province by the politically connected company Lin Vatey.

data.title: Cambodian fishermen turn to raising eels as Tonle Sap lake runs out of fish - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Em Phat, 53, studies his eel tanks with the intensity of a man gambling with his livelihood.

data.title: Can Hun Manet chart Cambodia a new course free from his father’s shadow? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The new PM’s first year in charge has been defined by attempts to bolster Cambodia’s international standing and prioritise strong China ties.

data.title: Centuries-Old Guardian Statue Unearthed in Remote Cambodian Temple - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Archaeologists continue to unearth artifacts and structures at Angkor.

data.title: Experts warn of regional impact and US concerns over Chinese warships - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia's increasing military ties with China, including the recent docking of Chinese warships, have sparked concerns about US influence in the region, the stability of the South China Sea, and Cambodia's neutrality within ASEAN.

data.title: Cambodian carbon credit project hit by rights abuse claims is reinstated - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Carbon credit certifying agency Verra announced on Sept. 10 that it has lifted the suspension of the Southern Cardamom REDD+ project in Cambodia following a roughly 14-month review of the project’s audits. Verified emissions reductions, better known as carbon credits, can now once more be issued by Cambodia’s flagship REDD+ project. The 465,000-hectare (1.15-million-acre) REDD+ […]

data.title: Cambodia welcomes return of looted treasures from US - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia on Aug 22 welcomed the return of a batch of trafficked Buddhist and Hindu statues from collectors and museums in the United States. RELATED In recent years, the kingdom has worked closely with US officials to secure the return of hundreds of precious cultural artefacts – many of them stolen and exported illegally. The […]
